intro: Struthanthus tenuicaulis, commonly known as the slender-stemmed globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb with a low, spreading growth habit and produces showy, yellow to orange flowers. The plant has slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. The flowers typically bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
